intro: Afrocanthium lactescens, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. Its latex is milky and can be toxic, containing cardiac glycosides. Afrocanthium lactescens is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, thriving in well-drained soils.
